Zulu singing may be well known nowadays, but the voices of two neighbouring peoples - the Sotho and the Tswana - have until now remained out of the spotlight. Their singing of songs of great beauty is both powerful and moving, and their voices are also very present in the festive ditlhaka reedpipe ensembles and eerie lesiba mouthbow songs.

Historical recordings by Hugh Tracey.


Quality: 192Kbps + cover scans
